item.title: Muv-Luv Unlimited: The Day After standalone versions coming to Switch
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

Previously exclusive to Muv-Luv 20th Odyssey Box.

aNCHOR will release all four episodes of Muv-Luv Unlimited: The Day After for Switch via Nintendo eShop, the company announced. Each episode will be sold separately, as well as together in a bundled set. A release date was not announced.

Muv-Luv Unlimited: The Day After is currently available for PC. The Switch release was previously exclusive to Muv-Luv 20th Odyssey Box, which included the four episodes as special bonus titles.

Here is an overview of each episode, via aNCHOR:

Picking up directly where Muv-Luv Unlimited left off, witness the aftermath of Alternative V, as the last remnants of humanity fight a desperate battle for survival on a barren and desolate Earth! Featuring a brand-new cast (with some returning fan-favorites thrown in for good measure!) and all-new challenges to face, this epic four-part saga is sure to please longtime fans and newcomers alike!

Muv-Luv Unlimited: The Day After – Episode 00 (Steam)

In a desperate attempt to exterminate the BETA, mankind has forsaken the Earth. Stranded onboard a TSF carrier in the South Pacific, a handful of survivors scramble to find a way back home to America. This is the beginning of The Day After…

Muv-Luv Unlimited: The Day After – Episode 01 (Steam)

The epic saga of The Day After continues! In the aftermath of Operation Babylon, only a few inhabitable places remain on Earth. Follow the Japanese survivors in Seattle as they struggle to rebuild their lives—and defend themselves from the BETA.

Muv-Luv Unlimited: The Day After – Episode 02 (Steam)

Muv-Luv Unlimited: The Day After continues! The Shogun has come to Seattle, and with her, an installation that might solve the ongoing food crisis. But tensions simmer beneath the surface, as an unseen enemy waits for its chance to strike.

Muv-Luv Unlimited: The Day After – Episode 03 (Steam)

The stakes grow higher in this latest episode of Muv-Luv Unlimited: The Day After! The shadow of nuclear annihilation looms over mankind, as France places the city of Seattle in the crosshairs. Can humanity overcome this crisis and unite to face the BETA?

item.title: Goat Simulator 3 DLC ‘Baadlands: Furry Road’ announced
item.content:encoded:
Publisher Coffee Stain Publishing and developer Coffee Stain North have announced Goat Simulator 3 downloadable content “Baadlands: Furry Road.” It will launch on November 19.

“We know what you’re thinking—sand is coarse and rough and irritating and it gets everywhere,” said Coffee Stain North creative director Santiago Ferrero in a press release. “But this expansion is so much more than that. There are outposts to pillage, ruins to explore, giant worms to admire, and suspiciously large amounts of leather clothing to wonder about. Oh, and don’t forget that mysterious vault door… What could be behind it? Probably more sand, to be honest.”

  • ❮
  • ❯

Here is an overview of the downloadable content, via Coffee Stain Publishing:

The world has ended and San Angora has devolved into chaos in the latest expansion coming to Goat Simulator 3! “Baadlands: Furry Road” will send players on an apocalyptic adventure across the wastelands of tomorrow.

San Angora has transformed into a vast desert for reasons unknown, and it’s now filled with sand-covered ruins of familiar locales. In the Baadlands, you take up the hooves of Baallistic Pilgor, the antihero and survivor of the apocalypse, to complete calamitous quests, scavenge for goat gears, and enjoy a plethora of post-apocalyptic parody in this mad new world of mutants and mystery.

The brand new trailer shared today showcased some of the more unique things players can expect to come across in the Baadlands, including wacky wagons of maximum madness, leather-wearing townsfolk, and giant dune-dwelling worms…

Players will also have access to a customizable motorcycle to traverse the sandy landscape in style, while ruining people’s days with loud motorcycle noises and tires to the face. It wouldn’t be a Goat Simulator expansion without new ways to harass the locals!

Goat Simulator 3 is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, PC via Steam, Epic Games Store, and Microsoft Store, iOS via App Store, and Android Google Play.

Watch a new trailer below. View a new set of screenshots at the gallery.

item.title: No Man’s Sky ‘Breach’ update now available
item.content:encoded:
Breach Expedition

In Breach, players will traverse a desolate and abandoned universe and on their travels encounter the abandoned remains of ill-fated corvette ships, all ripe for scavenging ship modules to add to your corvette-building arsenal.

Excavating these wrecks will yield an array of corvette pieces including rare vertical parts which unlock a whole new range of build configurations for the more creative designers.

Among the exclusive expedition rewards, there is also a set of Atlas-themed modules for those wanting to demonstrate their allegiance to the all-seeing entity.

The jewel in the crown of these wreckages is the Fireship Arcadia, the fate of which you will learn as you venture through Breach. But you will have to face your fears and make a leap of faith into the black as you space-walk through these eerie systems to glean their unique remnants.

The spooky Breach Expedition embraces the darker side of the universe and will also lure the bravest Travellers towards the ominous and exotic purple-star solar systems which players first glimpsed in Worlds Part II back in January. The planets in these systems are particularly foreboding with their deep, abyssal oceans, unearthly entities and the notoriously imposing and volatile gas giants.

The Breach Expedition begins today, and will run for approximately three weeks.

Space Wreckage

In the far reaches of deep space, wrecked corvettes can now be encountered and salvaged. Step out into zero-gravity to explore these hollow hulks, and equip your Multi-Tool laser to dismantle their valuable modules – then repurpose this scrap to build your dream ship at a Corvette Workshop.

New Corvette Modules
A significant number of new corvette modules are now salvageable from deep-space corvette wrecks and planetary scrapheaps. These include new landing gear, shields, weapons, connectors, and a number of highly-requested wedge-shaped modules that enable a huge variety of creative and complicated corvette builds.

Quality of Life

In addition to the bundle of fixes, improvements, and new features in today’s update, the No Man’s Sky team have been hard at work on improving Voyagers since its launch in August. Notably, snapping is greatly improved, collision is more robust, and the Corvette Workshop now offers the option to apply a colour palette to an entire corvette. There has never been a better time to build a corvette!

Breach Expedition Rewards

Event Horizon, Eternal Serpents, and Siren of the Stars Posters

These decorative posters commemorating the Breach expedition depict a deep-space gravitational anomaly, the tileable eternal serpent of time, and a betentacled siren, poised to begin its mucal embrace…

Aeron Cowling and Diffuser

The geometry of these corvette modules is ancient and unmistakable, shaped by the crimson heartbeat of the universe itself.

The extruded Aeron Cowling and Aeron Diffuser hull plates add a bold, angular appearance to your corvette’s silhouette.

Wings of Aeron

This Atlas-themed wing module stabilises the corvette during atmospheric flight.

Aeron Powershield

The Aeron Powershield is linked to the corvette’s shielding system, providing a significant performance boost to the ship’s defence array.

Aeron Winglet, Aeron Pillar, and Aeron Pyramid

These decorative Atlas-themed modules can be affixed to the corvette exterior, furthering the ship’s devotion to the crimson entity.

Aeron Starship Trail

This engine modification injects the Starship exhaust trail with an arterial streak of crimson.

Aeron Drive and Aeron Blade

Design a hefty, heavyweight Atlas corvette with the bulky Aeron Drive, or favour a more lightweight, sleek aesthetic with the streamlined Aeron Blade wing.

Development Update

It has been a crazy year for the No Man’s Sky team, with barely a breath taken between Worlds Part II, Relics, Beacon, and Voyagers. We’re so proud and pleased to be able to continue working on this game we all love so much nine years after launch. Seeing so many folks enjoying Voyagers has really inspired us, and we can’t wait for you to see what we have in store in future.

Our journey continues.
